Repeal lowered NYC drink prices briefly due to much competition. Champagne was $7-$9 per quart (vs. $15-$20 in speakeasies). #RepealDay

At the moment of repeal, 600 'padlock cases' against speakeasies were dropped, according to US District Attorney Thomas Dewey. #RepealDay
According to NYTimes, Bloomingdale's was the first to sell liquor to a customer in NYC -- a bottle of port and a pint of rye. #RepealDay
Conveniently, White Star line Majestic docked on #RepealDay w. 6,200 cases of wine and spirits. Speakeasies also sold stock to legit places.
On #RepealDay 1933, liquors stores (those who had booze conveniently available) could not sell until Utah finally passed repeal at 5:32 EST.
